entry.title: Week 1, 2026: Documentation updates removing DkML instructions and infrastructure improvements to HTTP scraping tools
entry.content:
Summary

Tutorial internationalization work ongoing while automated content scraping merged new blog posts and videos

Activity

  • Tutorial internationalization draft PR by mt_caret continues with initial framework for I18n of tutorial documentation affecting 77 files (#3238)
  • Automated content updates merged throughout the week with new OCaml blog posts and videos scraped including the OCaml Weekly News from December 30 and a blog post about multi-domain OCaml on Raspberry Pi Pico 2 microcontroller (#3439, #3438, #3436, #3431)
entry.summary: Documentation updates removing DkML instructions and infrastructure improvements to HTTP scraping tools

entry.title: Week 52, 2025: Exception logging improvements merged, new blog content scraped, website downtime resolved
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened to add blog source, automated content scraping merged, website outage resolved

Activity

  • New blog source proposed by Chris Armstrong to add OCaml-related posts from chrisarmstrong.dev to the planet feed (#3428)
  • Automated content scraping merged three PRs adding new OCaml blog posts and videos to the planet (#3429, #3430, #3431)
  • Website downtime on December 26 reported by Daniel Bünzli with connections timing out, resolved by Mark Elvers (#3432)
entry.summary: Exception logging improvements merged, new blog content scraped, website downtime resolved

entry.title: Week 51, 2025: Security team membership update, new blog source added to Planet, and documentation updates
entry.content:
Summary

Two open PRs for dependency updates and editor setup improvements, plus automated blog content scraping

Activity

  • Neovim setup documentation improvements under active review with Charlène_Gros updating ocaml.nvim installation instructions (#3421), receiving detailed feedback from Ulysse and Etienne on plugin manager approaches and configuration examples
  • DkML installation removal proposed by @jonahbeckford following project sunsetting announcement (#3425)
  • Dependency updates with Dependabot proposing peter-evans/create-pull-request upgrade from v7 to v8 (#3418)
  • Automated content scraping with daily blog post and video updates merged throughout the week (#3417, #3420, #3422, #3423)
  • Dune Package Management migration continuing with sabine maintaining comprehensive PR addressing build workflow updates (#3281)
entry.summary: Security team membership update, new blog source added to Planet, and documentation updates

entry.title: Week 50, 2025: Content updates with new blog posts and refreshed job listing
entry.content:
Summary

Automated content scraping added 19 new blog posts from Advent of OCaml and community sources

Activity

  • Automated content additions through three scraping runs brought 19 new blog posts and videos to OCaml Planet, including the complete Advent of OCaml 2025 series (13 posts covering Base32 Crockford, JSON Feed, XDG filesystem paths, ClaudeIO, BytesRW-Eio adapters, YAML 1.2, JSON/YAML conversion, Sortal contacts CLI, Bonsai TUI, and Mosaic TUI), OCaml Weekly News (Dec 9), technical articles on SVG rendering and email search webapps as unikernels, Albatross server management, OCamlNvim LSP integration, OCaml November roundup, and Advent of Code 2025 (#3412, #3414, #3415)
  • Job listing update merged to refresh the LexiFi OCaml developer position entry with updated publication date and location details (#3413)
entry.summary: Content updates with new blog posts and refreshed job listing

entry.title: Week 49, 2025: Content updates with new blog posts, videos, and documentation for opam-repository infrastructure
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened for infrastructure documentation and conference data, plus automated content updates

Activity

  • Two new PRs opened this week include opam-repository infrastructure documentation by sabine (#3407) and FUN OCaml 2025 conference data (#3411), both awaiting review
  • Automated content scraping successfully merged five PRs that added new blog posts and videos from the OCaml community including technical posts on Windows opam challenges, GitHub Actions automation, OCurrent private repository access, and ICFP conference recaps (#3405, #3406, #3408, #3409, #3410)
  • FUN OCaml 2025 content being added to the site includes conference videos and talks covering systems programming perspectives, AI integration strategies, and formal verification techniques
entry.summary: Content updates with new blog posts, videos, and documentation for opam-repository infrastructure

entry.title: Week 48, 2025: Content updates with new blog posts and tutorial improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Automated content aggregation added five new blog posts to OCaml Planet

Activity

  • OCaml Planet content expanded with five new blog posts automatically scraped and merged throughout the week, including posts on collective knowledge systems, OCaml Weekly News, Jane Street's FPGA Advent challenge, Emacs LSP server integration, and OCaml 5.4 ARM32 support (#3400, #3402, #3403, #3404)
  • Tutorial documentation improvements merged by Cuihtlauac Alvarado fixing three typos in the Maps and Sets tutorials contributed by Rong "Mantle" Bao (#3399)
  • Dependency maintenance completed with Dependabot updating GitHub Actions checkout action from v5 to v6 across five workflow files (#3401)
entry.summary: Content updates with new blog posts and tutorial improvements

entry.title: Week 47, 2025: Added opam 2.5.0~beta1 changelog, fixed video scraper buffer overflow, and improved documentation generation tutorial
entry.content:
Summary

One new PR opened for typo fixes in language tutorials, plus automated content aggregation and dependency updates merged

Activity

  • New PR opened by Rong "Mantle" Bao fixing three typos in language tutorials (#3399)
  • Content aggregation through automated scraping brought in 13 new blog posts and videos from the OCaml community, including posts on OCaml containers in Azure, UK/India AI Summit, compiler news, priority queue testing with Monolith, opam repository security, MirageOS unikernel developments, and more (#3398, #3397)
  • GitHub Actions dependency update bumping DavidAnson/markdownlint-cli2-action from version 20 to 21, updating markdownlint-cli2 to v0.19.0 and markdownlint to v0.39.0 (#3396)
entry.summary: Added opam 2.5.0~beta1 changelog, fixed video scraper buffer overflow, and improved documentation generation tutorial

entry.title: Week 46, 2025: New PR opened to add opam 2.5.0~beta1 changelog to the website
entry.content:
Summary

PR opened to document opam 2.5.0~beta1 release

Activity

  • Kate opened a PR to add the changelog for opam 2.5.0~beta1 to the website (#3395)
entry.summary: New PR opened to add opam 2.5.0~beta1 changelog to the website

entry.title: Week 45, 2025: Documentation improvements including new compilation target guides and infrastructure article; automated blog scraping continued
entry.content:
Summary

Three ongoing PRs addressing video scraper bug, compilation target review feedback, and automated blog content updates

Activity

  • Video scraper fix in progress by sabine to increase YAML buffer size and address decode error preventing automated video scraping from completing successfully (#3392, fixing bug from #3390)
  • Documentation tutorial enhancement opened by sabine adding dune ocaml doc command to the generating-documentation tutorial, suggested by Ali Caglayan (#3391)
  • Compilation targets documentation merged after extensive review by sabine with comprehensive pages for native, bytecode, JavaScript, WebAssembly, and unikernel targets, receiving detailed spelling and style suggestions from @ILeandersson for British English consistency and feedback from Frédéric Loyer about WebAssembly and MirageOS build tools (#3378)
  • Infrastructure documentation merged describing opam-repository operations, CI architecture, governance policies, and maintainer acknowledgments with review feedback from Anil Madhavapeddy clarifying infrastructure funding and Mark Elvers ensuring IBM/Marist s390x support was properly credited (#3379)
  • Automated blog scraping continued with merged PRs adding new OCaml blog posts and videos (#3387, #3389) and Ryan Gibb's OCaml feed added to planet sources (#3388)
entry.summary: Documentation improvements including new compilation target guides and infrastructure article; automated blog scraping continued

entry.title: Week 44, 2025: Content updates including OCaml Workshop 2025 details, tutorial improvements, and automated blog post additions
entry.content:
Summary

Three open PRs under review including Dune package management adoption and compilation targets documentation

Activity

  • Draft documentation on OCaml compilation targets by @sabine describing native, bytecode, and other compilation modes with reference links to Dune manual, currently in draft status with community feedback from Frédéric Loyer suggesting Dune manual cross-references (#3378)
  • Backstage OCaml post on opam-repository by @sabine explaining how the opam-repository ecosystem works, with extensive community discussion involving Anil Madhavapeddy, Thomas Gazagnaire, Hannes Mehnert, Mark Elvers, Kate, and Marcello Seri about infrastructure funding, maintainer recognition, and ecosystem details (#3379)
  • Dune Package Management adoption by @sabine migrating the OCaml.org build from opam to Dune's package management system, addressing Docker build issues and performance impacts, with ongoing collaboration with Cuihtlauac Alvarado and Antonin Décimo (#3281)
  • Ahrefs success story by @sabine adding new case study about full stack web development with OCaml (#3336)
entry.summary: Content updates including OCaml Workshop 2025 details, tutorial improvements, and automated blog post additions

entry.title: Week 43, 2025: opam 2.5.0~alpha1 release announced, documentation work on compilation targets and opam-repository infrastructure
entry.content:
Summary

Documentation expansion for OCaml compilation targets and opam-repository infrastructure, automated content updates

Activity

  • New documentation PRs opened this week include PPX tutorial cleanup by Tazmilur Saad (#3382), comprehensive compilation targets documentation by sabine covering bytecode, native code, JavaScript, WebAssembly, and unikernel targets (#3378), and detailed opam-repository infrastructure article explaining the CI system, governance, and maintainer processes (#3379)
  • Content aggregation continued with automated scraping of OCaml Planet blog posts and videos, bringing in ICFP 2025 reflections, conference coverage, and community content across four automated PRs (#3375, #3377, #3380, #3381)
  • Bug fix for playground editor keyboard shortcut conflict where pressing / would incorrectly focus the search bar instead of allowing input in the code editor (#3031)
entry.summary: opam 2.5.0~alpha1 release announced, documentation work on compilation targets and opam-repository infrastructure

entry.title: Week 42, 2025: Mobile UI improvements for package pages and new content additions
entry.content:
Summary

Dune Package Management migration ongoing, new blog posts published, automated content updates

Activity

  • Dune Package Management migration for OCaml.org build system remains under active development by @sabine, with related announcement PR (#3152) closed in favor of merged content in (#3281)
  • Backstage OCaml blog additions include announcement of ocaml.nvim Neovim plugin by @sabine providing advanced LSP features like typed holes navigation and semantic code movement (#3372), and Gospel ecosystem status update by @sabine describing ready-to-use testing tools and evolving proof capabilities (#3352)
  • Automated content scraping merged two updates adding OCaml community blog posts and videos (#3374, #3373)
entry.summary: Mobile UI improvements for package pages and new content additions

entry.title: Week 41, 2025: OCaml 5.4.0 released with content improvements and new Backstage OCaml section for experimental features
entry.content:
Summary

Website infrastructure improvements, documentation fixes, and ongoing Dune Package Management PR discussion

Activity

  • Two PRs remain open awaiting review: Dune Package Management adoption for OCaml.org build by @sabine (#3281) and Ahrefs full-stack web success story by @sabine (#3336)
  • Infrastructure and organizational improvements included renaming platformtoolsreleases to platformreleases, adding releasedongithubby field for better attribution tracking, fixing Backstage OCaml feed name, and moving merlin-domains post to editors folder (#3365, #3361, #3357, #3356, #3351)
  • Documentation fixes corrected OCaml 5.4.0 release date and RFC link by Khalid (#3368), fixed adjacency list in graph example by @feefs (#3371), and removed duplicate titles (#3350)
  • Markdown linter configuration updated to disable rules around space before/after code blocks and lists to reduce false positives (#3360)
  • Content aggregation through automated scraping brought in new OCaml Planet blog posts including LexiFi at FUN OCaml, Ahrefs one-year retrospective, OCaml Weekly News, and Tunbury blog posts about Docker and FreeBSD updates (#3370, #3359, #3348, #3342)
  • PR workflow closed superseding old Alpine/opam update by Antonin Décimo (#2831) and platform releases scraper PR already addressed through individual announcements (#3349, #3309)
entry.summary: OCaml 5.4.0 released with content improvements and new Backstage OCaml section for experimental features

entry.title: Week 40, 2025: Documentation improvements and new Security Response Team announcement dominated the week
entry.content:
Summary

Ongoing Dune Package Management migration, security infrastructure improvements, and active documentation expansion

Activity

  • Dune Package Management migration (#3281) by sabine remains in progress with active discussion about Docker build issues on Ubuntu 25.04 and performance impacts, though initial testing shows promising build times
  • Basic authentication cookbook (#3201) by Odinaka Joy awaiting review, demonstrating header manipulation and mock user authorization
  • Merlin-domains announcement post (#3339) drafted by sabine for Backstage OCaml series about upcoming Lambda World talk
  • Security Response Team announcement added to OCaml Changelog (#3337) by sabine, establishing formal security vulnerability reporting process
  • Governance page cleanup (#3306) by Sacha Ayoun removed deprecated mailing lists, redirecting users to GitHub issues and Discuss forum
  • Zulip link updated (#3328) by Sacha Ayoun from caml.zulipchat.com to ocaml.zulipchat.com
  • Automated content scraping continued with new blog posts and videos (#3340, #3334, #3332)
  • Platform release updates accumulated in automated PR (#3309) with 224 additions across 9 files
entry.summary: Documentation improvements and new Security Response Team announcement dominated the week

entry.title: Week 39, 2025: Website content updates with new blog posts and documentation improvements alongside governance page maintenance
entry.content:
Summary

Community maintenance focused on documentation improvements and governance updates with ongoing work on Neovim setup guides

Activity

  • Neovim documentation being developed by Jacob Kim to add LSP server setup instructions for both nvim-lspconfig and vim.lsp methods (#3322)
  • Governance page cleanup proposed by Sacha Ayoun to remove inactive mailing lists that haven't been used since 2020, with discussion involving Anil Madhavapeddy about email service being taken down due to spam (#3306)
  • Community infrastructure updates including Zulip link migration from caml.zulipchat.com to ocaml.zulipchat.com by Sacha Ayoun (#3328)
  • Automated content pipeline continuing to function with regular blog post imports from the OCaml Planet feed (#3331, #3329, #3326, #3325)
  • Platform release tracking through ongoing automated PR from GitHub Actions monitoring new platform releases (#3309)
entry.summary: Website content updates with new blog posts and documentation improvements alongside governance page maintenance

entry.title: Week 38, 2025: Editor setup improvements for Neovim users and automated content updates through community contributions
entry.content:
Summary

New documentation for Neovim setup opened and automated content scraping delivered multiple blog posts and dependency updates

Activity

  • New PR opened for Neovim editor setup documentation by Jacob Kim adding LSP configuration for both nvim-lspconfig and vim.lsp methods (#3322)
  • Automated content updates merged through scraping workflows including blog posts and videos (#3314, #3316, #3317, #3318, #3320)
  • Dependency maintenance with GitHub Actions workflow updated by Dependabot bumping tj-actions/changed-files from v46 to v47 (#3315)
  • Shell environment documentation improvements ongoing with Tim Hutt adding opam env instructions for nushell shell on Windows (#3307) with review feedback from David Allsopp
entry.summary: Editor setup improvements for Neovim users and automated content updates through community contributions

entry.title: Week 37, 2025: Major security infrastructure improvements with new security pages, Zulip chat integration, and web documentation updates
entry.content:
Summary

Active week featuring collaborative security documentation effort, community infrastructure improvements, and regular content automation

Activity

  • New security infrastructure request by Hannes Mehnert from OCaml Security Response Team seeking to add security pages and disclosure process documentation (#3299)
  • Governance enhancement proposal by Sacha Ayoun requesting calendar integration for governance meetings to improve transparency (#3305)
  • Development environment issues reported by Sacha Ayoun with devcontainer build failures due to incompatible LSP and Yojson versions (#3304)
  • User support inquiry by aceking seeking VSCode debugging setup guidance for OCaml 5.1.1 (#3310)
  • Documentation issue report by Cuihtlauac Alvarado identifying broken Irminfsunix.KV documentation link (#3312)
  • Collaborative implementation of security pages by Cuihtlauac Alvarado with 40 comments and extensive discussion on proper integration approach (#3300)
  • Package release announcement for Dune 3.20.2 by Etienne updating changelog (#3302)
  • Automated content updates through multiple GitHub Actions scraping blog posts and videos from OCaml Planet (#3298, #3308, #3313)
entry.summary: Major security infrastructure improvements with new security pages, Zulip chat integration, and web documentation updates

entry.title: Week 36, 2025: Documentation fixes and content additions with automated content scraping updates from community blogs
entry.content:
Summary

Major Dune Package Management adoption effort ongoing with documentation content additions and automated scraping

Activity

  • Dune Package Management adoption continues as an open effort by @sabine to modernize the OCaml.org build system with performance improvements and simplified dependency management (#3281)
  • Documentation link fixes completed by deltadelta and @kurekszymon addressing broken memory representation and odoc references that were preventing user access to important documentation (#3292, #3295, #3296)
  • Automated content updates delivered through regular scraping including OCaml Platform Newsletter for August 2025 by @sabine (#3290) and community blog posts from OCaml Planet (#3285, #3286, #3287, #3293)
  • Package documentation improvements with Guillaume Munch-Maccagnoni reporting issues with image assets and math formatting in generated documentation pages affecting user experience (#3294, #3233)
entry.summary: Documentation fixes and content additions with automated content scraping updates from community blogs

entry.title: Week 35, 2025: Major infrastructure modernization with Dune package management adoption and new content organization framework
entry.content:
Summary

Significant build system modernization efforts alongside regular content maintenance and community growth activities

Activity

  • Major open PRs include comprehensive Dune package management adoption by @sabine (#3281) and introduction of "Backstage OCaml" content organization framework (#3278)
  • Platform release announcements with Dune 3.20.1 release by Etienne (#3274) and ocaml-eglot tool announcement by @sabine (#3080)
  • Community content expansion through addition of Mark Elvers' blog by Cuihtlauac Alvarado (#3277) and Chukwuma Akunyili's blog integration (#3260)
  • Content infrastructure improvements through blog syndication cleanup by Cuihtlauac Alvarado (#3272) and FUN OCaml 2025 event addition by @sabine (#3275)
  • Maintenance activities including job posting cleanup by @daniellamping (#3282) and regular automated content scraping (#3271, #3276, #3279, #3284)
entry.summary: Major infrastructure modernization with Dune package management adoption and new content organization framework

entry.title: Week 34, 2025: Blog scraping infrastructure improvements with bug fixes and separate branch handling for automated scrapers
entry.content:
Summary

Blog aggregation issues resolved with infrastructure fixes and Dune package management transition closed

Activity

  • Blog aggregation infrastructure fixes dominated the week with Hannes Mehnert reporting missing Robur blog posts (#3263) and Cuihtlauac Alvarado implementing fixes for both specific cases (#3266) and broader filtering regression (#3267)
  • Automated scraping improvements delivered through separate branch handling (#3269) and successful content recovery with multiple scraper runs adding blog posts from Robur, Tarides, Anil, and Jon Ludlam (#3270, #3271, #3262)
  • Content updates included Dune 3.20.0 changelog by Etienne (#3265) and authentication package cleanup by Yawar Amin (#3258)
  • Dune package management transition concluded with sabine closing both the long-running original PR (#3132) and replacement attempt (#3280) after extensive review requirements
entry.summary: Blog scraping infrastructure improvements with bug fixes and separate branch handling for automated scrapers

entry.title: Week 33, 2025: Enhanced changelog scraper infrastructure and added hundreds of historical OCaml Platform release announcements
entry.content:
Summary

Ongoing internationalization work and one new blog post submission, plus comprehensive changelog maintenance across all OCaml Platform tools

Activity

  • Internationalization initiative progressing with mt_caret working on tutorial localization affecting 74 files (#3238)
  • New content additions including Azure deployment journey blog post by Chukwuma Akunyili (#3259) and planet source updates (#3260)
  • Comprehensive changelog maintenance by @sabine including restoration of alpha/beta/rc releases (#3226), addition of missing releases for merlin (#3250), ocaml-lsp (#3250), ppxlib (#3251), ocamlformat (#3251), ocp-indent (#3251), utop (#3249), odoc (#3248), and opam-publish (#3253)
  • Infrastructure improvements with workflow updates to use Node.js 24 via actions/checkout v5 by Dependabot (#3244)
  • Package documentation updates including removal of non-existent auth package and webauthn package description improvements by Yawar Amin (#3258)
  • OCaml-eglot announcement merged after extensive community review discussing Emacs IDE tooling evolution (#3080)
entry.summary: Enhanced changelog scraper infrastructure and added hundreds of historical OCaml Platform release announcements

entry.title: Week 32, 2025: Content additions with new Cambridge CS textbook, blog scraping improvements, and planet feed updates
entry.content:
Summary

Week focused on content improvements with one draft I18n PR opened plus merged contributions including new educational material and blog content

Activity

  • Draft I18n implementation opened by mt_caret for tutorial internationalization with 423 additions across 74 files, representing initial steps toward multilingual tutorial support (#3238)
  • Educational content expansion completed with Mostafa Touny contributing Cambridge University's Computer Science Foundations textbook covering OCaml fundamentals and algorithm design (#3239)
  • Content curation improvements delivered by Patrick Ferris updating planet feed sources for more targeted OCaml content (#3242)
  • Automated blog scraping continued with two successful runs adding extensive community content including OCaml weekly updates, technical articles, and project retrospectives (#3240, #3243)
  • Infrastructure improvements merged from previous week's work by sabine enhancing changelog scraper capabilities for automated release tracking (#3217)
entry.summary: Content additions with new Cambridge CS textbook, blog scraping improvements, and planet feed updates

entry.title: Week 31, 2025: Build configuration cleanup with automated content updates and new issues addressing math rendering and accessibility
entry.content:
Summary

Three new PRs opened including I18n work for tutorials, plus merged content updates and dependency cleanup

Activity

  • New internationalization work started by mt_caret with initial steps towards I18n support for tutorial documentation (#3238)
  • Ongoing development includes large-scale Dune Package Management migration by sabine (#3132) and changelog post about the migration (#3152)
  • Merged improvements delivered enhanced changelog scraper capabilities by sabine for automated PR creation from OCaml Platform releases (#3217), plus build cleanup removing deprecated tools by Cuihtlauac Alvarado (#3237)
entry.summary: Build configuration cleanup with automated content updates and new issues addressing math rendering and accessibility

entry.title: Week 30, 2025: Content updates with opam 2.4.0 and 2.4.1 changelog additions plus automated blog post aggregation
entry.content:
Summary

Website maintenance dominated by opam release documentation and automated content aggregation

Activity

  • opam release documentation completed by Kate with comprehensive changelogs for both opam 2.4.0 and 2.4.1 releases detailing breaking changes, new features, and bug fixes (#3223, #3228)
  • Automated content updates delivered through scrape.yml workflow adding new blog posts from OCaml Planet including technical articles and community content across four separate updates (#3227, #3229, #3230, #3231)
  • Content management addressed by @sabine preparing for changelog reorganization with revert of alpha/beta changelog removal to support future split between stable OCaml Changelog and experimental Backstage OCaml (#3226)
  • Performance issue resolution confirmed by Christopher Fujino with API documentation memory usage reduced from 615-850MB to 56.9-208MB range (#3150)
entry.summary: Content updates with opam 2.4.0 and 2.4.1 changelog additions plus automated blog post aggregation

entry.title: Week 29, 2025: Automated changelog scraper for OCaml Platform releases launched with documentation improvements and content updates
entry.content:
Summary

Comprehensive scraper infrastructure development, opam 2.4.0 changelog addition, and automated planet content updates

Activity

  • Scraper infrastructure improvements including planet scraping fixes by Cuihtlauac Alvarado (#3218, #3219, #3220, #3222) addressing GitHub Actions errors and linting exclusions
  • Platform release documentation with Kate adding opam 2.4.0 changelog and cleaning up misplaced alpha release documentation (#3223)
  • Automated content updates from GitHub Actions bot adding new OCaml blog posts and videos (#3215, #3221, #3224, #3225)
  • Open cookbook contribution by Odinaka Joy for basic authentication with ongoing discussion about security considerations (#3201)
entry.summary: Automated changelog scraper for OCaml Platform releases launched with documentation improvements and content updates

entry.title: Week 28, 2025: Website maintenance week with bug fixes, documentation improvements, and new success stories added.
entry.content:
Summary

One new cookbook PR opened, multiple website fixes merged, and three new company success stories published.

Activity

  • New cookbook PR opened by Odinaka Joy implementing basic authentication for secure routes (#3201), currently under security review
  • Website bug fixes completed by @sabine addressing JSON cookbook syntax errors (#3212), package dependency labeling (#3214), RSS feed URLs (#3211), and opam switch documentation clarity (#3213)
  • Success stories published for three companies: Robur's infrastructure software (#2862), VCAST's testing tools (#3198), and Imandra's formal verification platform with temporary revert and republication (#2868, #3205, #3206)
  • Academic content expanded with Fabrice Le Fessant adding seven OCaml Workshop papers to the research showcase (#3208)
  • Documentation improvements merged including Jakub Svec's enhancements to Options (#2986) and Hashtbl tutorials (#3009)
  • Automated content updates through multiple scraping runs adding new blog posts and videos (#3202, #3203, #3207, #3209)
entry.summary: Website maintenance week with bug fixes, documentation improvements, and new success stories added.

entry.title: Week 27, 2025: JSON cookbook fixes, success stories added, automated content scraping, and blog feed expansion
entry.content:
Summary

Two new cookbook PRs opened, package documentation infrastructure work completed, success stories published

Activity

  • New cookbook contributions opened including basic authentication for secure routes by Odinaka Joy (#3201) and web server HTML template rendering (#3185)
  • Package documentation infrastructure completed with Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac merging odoc 3 integration featuring global sidebar, improved breadcrumbs, source code pages, and URL redirections (#3124)
  • Success story content published with @sabine adding VCAST success story (#3198) and Imandra case study (#3206)
  • Cookbook maintenance completed by Kyle J. Davis and Cuihtlauac Alvarado fixing syntax errors in JSON examples (#3196, #3197)
  • Blog integration expanded with Tim McGilchrist adding personal blog feed (#3199) and Yawar Amin contributing personal blog (#3192)
entry.summary: JSON cookbook fixes, success stories added, automated content scraping, and blog feed expansion

entry.title: Week 26, 2025: Infrastructure improvements and content updates with CI workflow optimizations and new blog content additions
entry.content:
Summary

New cookbook PR opened for web server tutorials while multiple infrastructure improvements and automated content updates were merged

Activity

  • New cookbook contribution opened by Odinaka Joy for web server and HTML template tutorial covering Dream and Cohttp frameworks (#3185)
  • Blog feed addition pending by Joel Reymont to add Zen of Coding OCaml content to Planet (#3183)
  • Infrastructure maintenance completed by Cuihtlauac Alvarado including Alpine upgrade, CI workflow modernization, and dependency cleanup (#3178, #3179, #3180)
  • Content automation delivering regular blog posts and videos through automated scraping (#3184, #3186, #3188)
  • Documentation fixes including typo correction by Sébastien Hinderer (#3182) and blog feed repair by Xavier Van de Woestyne (#3190)
  • Documentation issue resolution for ppx_minidebug package documentation deployment (#3096)
entry.summary: Infrastructure improvements and content updates with CI workflow optimizations and new blog content additions

entry.title: Week 25, 2025: Active week with three new cookbook entries for web servers, hash tables, and date formatting plus homepage improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Busy week with 13 merged PRs focusing on cookbook expansion, content improvements, and new Parsimoni success story

Activity

  • Cookbook expansion with three substantial new recipes covering essential OCaml programming patterns including hash table operations (#3165), web server setup with multiple framework options (#3166), and date formatting utilities (#3158)
  • Content quality improvements through homepage function renaming for better accessibility (#3176), tutorial typo corrections in sequences (#3177) and meta-programming guides (#3182), and documentation formatting fixes (#3181)
  • Success story addition featuring new Parsimoni case study by @sabine with complete implementation including media assets (#2857) and subsequent link enhancements (#3172, #3173)
  • Release documentation with Dune 3.19.1 changelog entry by Etienne (#3164)
  • Automated content updates through planet blog post scraping bringing in fresh OCaml community content (#3171, #3174)
  • Open development work includes ongoing Dune package management migration discussion (#3132) and changelog preparation for migration announcement (#3152)
entry.summary: Active week with three new cookbook entries for web servers, hash tables, and date formatting plus homepage improvements

entry.title: Week 24, 2025: Website improvements included security enhancements, playground fixes, and expanded cookbook content with 13 PRs merged.
entry.content:
Summary

Strong focus on content expansion through cookbook recipes, maintenance updates, and automated blog post integration.

Activity

  • Open PR initiatives include Dune Package Management migration announcement by @sabine (#3152) and Topiary code formatter documentation addition by @toastal (#3097)
  • Website maintenance completed with broken link fixes including Diskuv GitLab pages by Yuri Myasoedov (#3153), defunct industrial user removal by Cuihtlauac Alvarado (#3155), and OCaml infrastructure documentation link updates by @sabine (#3157)
  • Changelog updates delivered with Dune 3.19.1 release notes by Etienne (#3164) and Dune Developer Preview UTM tracking enhancements by @sabine (#3161)
  • Automated content integration through daily Planet blog and video scraping (#3154, #3159, #3163, #3170) plus minor formatting improvements (#3169)
entry.summary: Website improvements included security enhancements, playground fixes, and expanded cookbook content with 13 PRs merged.

entry.title: Week 23, 2025: Development focus on Dune Package Management migration with documentation improvements, build fixes, and new tutorial content
entry.content:
Summary

Migration to Dune Package Management continued with changelog draft, while documentation and user experience improvements were delivered

Activity

  • New PR opened for Dune Package Management migration announcement by sabine documenting the transition process (#3152)
  • Major merged PRs included updated package documentation with odoc 3 features by Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac improving global sidebar and breadcrumbs (#3124), and changelog scraper for missing releases by Jules Aguillon (#2949)
  • Documentation enhancements delivered through improved CEA industrial user description (#2839) and multiple new blog posts including OCaml Weekly News and Tarides project updates
  • Build system improvements included overlay repository addition for better dependency resolution (#3147) and removal of olinkcheck dependency (#3144)
  • Large-scale Dune Package Management migration remained stalled with #3132 in closed state, while related issues about OCaml version constraints (#3145) and Makefile compatibility (#3148) continue to be investigated
entry.summary: Development focus on Dune Package Management migration with documentation improvements, build fixes, and new tutorial content

entry.title: Week 22, 2025: Website improvements include new OCaml infrastructure documentation, PostHog heatmaps, Dune lock directory blog post, and build fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Two new PRs opened including Dune Package Management adoption and Topiary formatter documentation, while multiple content and infrastructure improvements were merged

Activity

  • Two new PRs opened this week for future development: sabine proposed Dune Package Management adoption with comprehensive build system changes (#3132) and @toastal added Topiary formatter documentation to code formatting guides (#3097)
  • Website content improvements delivered by sabine adding OCaml Infrastructure documentation (#3107), Stephen Sherratt publishing Dune portable lock directories blog post (#3113), and Etienne adding Dune 3.19.0 changelog (#3129)
  • Infrastructure and build improvements by Mark Elvers fixing Docker build with backup mirror support (#3130), Cuihtlauac Alvarado upgrading scraper to OCaml 5.2.0 (#3137), and sabine updating markdown linting configuration (#3139)
  • Documentation and content fixes including Sébastien Hinderer correcting compiler release note typos (#3133), FengTDI implementing treeofstring function for problem 70A (#3135), and automated blog post updates (#3138, #3142)
  • Analytics enhancement with sabine enabling PostHog heatmaps for user behavior tracking (#3141)
entry.summary: Website improvements include new OCaml infrastructure documentation, PostHog heatmaps, Dune lock directory blog post, and build fixes

entry.title: Week 21, 2025: OCaml Planet filtering functionality, new book addition, and tooling improvements were delivered alongside automated content updates
entry.content:
Summary

New PR opened for package documentation improvements, ongoing discussion about OCaml Planet content optimization, and bug report filed for book cover crashes

Activity

  • New documentation infrastructure PR opened by Paul-Elliot Anglès d'Auriac implementing odoc 3 features including global sidebar, improved breadcrumbs, and source code pages (#3124)
  • OCaml Planet content management discussion initiated by Yawar Amin questioning need for storing full post bodies since only descriptions are displayed (#3120)
  • Book cover rendering bug reported by Cuihtlauac Alvarado causing crashes on invalid file paths in books section (#3112)
  • Automated content updates included new OCaml Planet posts from various contributors and OCaml Weekly News edition for May 20, 2025
entry.summary: OCaml Planet filtering functionality, new book addition, and tooling improvements were delivered alongside automated content updates

entry.title: Week 20, 2025: Content improvements and infrastructure enhancements including markdown linting setup and tutorial syntax fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Content additions with extensive blog post integration and opam changelog updates

Activity

  • Content expansion with substantial additions to OCaml Planet including hundreds of historical blog posts from Anil Makhijani (multiple commits), David Allsopp, @ryangibb, and Jon Ludlam
  • OPAM documentation updates with changelog entries for 2.4.0~alpha1 (#3069) and 2.4.0~alpha2 (#3090) releases
  • Academic institution data updates including new institutions and course information revisions
  • Job posting additions with new position listings (#3109)
  • Content management including adding and then reverting course notes (#3093, #3108)
entry.summary: Content improvements and infrastructure enhancements including markdown linting setup and tutorial syntax fixes

entry.title: Week 19, 2025: Content updates including Dune 3.18.2 changelog, December 2024 Outreachy round addition, and r2c to Semgrep rebrand
entry.content:
Summary

Website content maintenance including governance updates, changelog additions, and blog post aggregation

Activity

  • Dune 3.18.2 changelog added documenting OCaml 5.4.0 compatibility fix to resolve sigwinch shadowing issue (#3087)
  • PPXLib governance updated with new maintainers Patrick Ferris and Nathan Rebours added to the team (#3091)
  • Industrial user rebranding from r2c to Semgrep with updated company description, URLs, and logo reflecting current focus on security platform (#3094)
  • December 2024 Outreachy program documentation added featuring structural diffing algorithm project for OCaml libraries API by Abdulaziz Alkurd mentored by Nathan Rebours (#3088)
  • OCaml Planet content aggregated including weekly news from May 6, 2025 and Tarides blog post about BOB Konferenz 2025 presentation on LSP and OCaml editor support (#3092, #3095)
entry.summary: Content updates including Dune 3.18.2 changelog, December 2024 Outreachy round addition, and r2c to Semgrep rebrand

entry.title: Week 18, 2025: Website reorganization and documentation improvements with major changelog restructuring and contributor guide enhancements
entry.content:
Summary

Active week with documentation improvements, site maintenance, and infrastructure work focused on user experience and content organization

Activity

  • New issue opened by zhangweijun reporting syntax error in functors tutorial (#3085)
  • New changelog PR opened by sabine for ocaml-eglot announcement awaiting content approval (#3080)
  • Website infrastructure improvements including removal of previously added ocaml-eglot entries (b87817c) and automatic blog post updates (db4b629)
  • Content organization initiatives with hundreds of changelog files relocated to establish clearer structure between release announcements and general posts
entry.summary: Website reorganization and documentation improvements with major changelog restructuring and contributor guide enhancements

entry.title: Week 17, 2025: Weekly content updates through automated blog scraping and new search shortcut feature request
entry.content:
Summary

Automated blog content updates and user experience enhancement request for documentation search

Activity

  • Automated content curation delivered through weekly OCaml Planet blog posts and video scraping with four separate updates (#3070, #3071, #3073, #3075) adding OCaml Weekly News for April 22nd and blog posts from OCamlPro on Flambda2 compiler design, Robur on email authentication protocols, and Tarides on MSVC port restoration
  • Documentation search enhancement proposed by Nicholas Yang requesting keyboard shortcut support for package documentation search, suggesting either overriding the existing / shortcut or implementing a new s shortcut similar to Rust documentation (#3074)
entry.summary: Weekly content updates through automated blog scraping and new search shortcut feature request

entry.title: Week 16, 2025: Website content updates including Dune 3.18.1 changelog, comprehensive Emacs editor setup tutorial, and governance changes
entry.content:
Summary

Content updates including code of conduct changes, new blog posts, and automated planet content scraping

Activity

  • Code of conduct team update replacing Sonja Heinze with Shon Feder in the moderation team (#3067)
  • CODEOWNERS file update adding @sabine as reviewer for changelog directory (#3061)
  • Automated content updates through scrape.yml workflow adding new OCaml Planet blog posts and videos (#3068, #3062, #3060)
  • Bug report filed by Nicholas Yang regarding search results linking to 404 pages for Core.Buffer documentation (#3066)
entry.summary: Website content updates including Dune 3.18.1 changelog, comprehensive Emacs editor setup tutorial, and governance changes

entry.title: Week 15, 2025: None

entry.summary: Activity report for ocaml/ocaml.org - Week 15, 2025

entry.title: Week 14, 2025: OCaml website updated with Dune 3.18.0 changelog and infrastructure updates plus new blog content about OCaml in space
entry.content:
Summary

Automated content updates through scraper bringing new blog posts and videos to OCaml Planet

Activity

  • Regular content scraping delivered four automated updates to OCaml Planet through scraper workflow, adding new blog posts including technical content about regular expressions and F# programming (#3042, #3045, #3049, #3051)
  • Notable blog content featured OCaml in space announcement from Tarides about SpaceOS running on satellite aboard DPhi Space's Clustergate platform launched with Transporter-13 mission
  • Technical writing included comprehensive tutorial on learning OCaml regular expressions and comparative analysis of F# programming language features
entry.summary: OCaml website updated with Dune 3.18.0 changelog and infrastructure updates plus new blog content about OCaml in space

entry.title: Week 13, 2025: Website content additions including new academic institution, OCaml Workshop events, and Planet blog posts
entry.content:
Summary

Three issues opened covering syntax highlighting bugs, polymorphic variants tutorial proposal, and playground editor issues

Activity

  • Syntax highlighting bug reported by Patrick Nicodemus affecting multiple code samples in tutorials where comment styling is incorrectly applied to OCaml expressions (#3037)
  • New polymorphic variants lesson proposed by Jakub Svec as comprehensive 800-line tutorial covering row polymorphism and structural typing concepts (#3036)
  • Playground editor keyboard issue identified by Colin James where / key triggers search focus instead of allowing code input, with potential fixes being discussed (#3031)
entry.summary: Website content additions including new academic institution, OCaml Workshop events, and Planet blog posts

entry.title: Week 12, 2025: Documentation improvements across multiple tutorials and new issues reporting playground limitations.
entry.content:
Summary

Three new issues opened addressing playground functionality problems and tutorial content proposals.

Activity

  • Playground functionality issues identified by Colin James reporting keyboard input problems where forward slash key triggers search focus instead of text input (#3031)
  • Effects support limitation reported by John Jackson documenting undefined global reference error for Stdlib__Effect in playground environment (#3030)
  • Tutorial content contribution proposal by Jakub Svec offering new lesson on Lazy module with focus on beginner-friendly evaluation strategies explanation (#3025)
entry.summary: Documentation improvements across multiple tutorials and new issues reporting playground limitations.

entry.title: Week 11, 2025: Major tutorial enhancements with pattern matching and sequence improvements plus website interface cleanup
entry.content:
Summary

Documentation improvements and website content updates with ongoing markdown linter integration discussions

Activity

  • Tutorial documentation received substantial improvements with Jakub Svec contributing pattern matching enhancements (#2959) and sequence tutorial updates (#3015)
  • Website interface cleanup included removing status indicators from "Is OCaml Yet" pages to improve readability (#3020)
  • Community content updates included adding new OCaml Planet blog feeds and automatic scraping of 11 new blog posts from bbatsov's OCaml learning series (#2978, #3016, #3018, #3019, #3023)
  • Package documentation was updated with ppxlib.0.36.0 changelog (#3017) and governance data updates (#3022)
entry.summary: Major tutorial enhancements with pattern matching and sequence improvements plus website interface cleanup

entry.title: Week 10, 2025: Content improvements week with Maps tutorial enhancements and tool modernization
entry.content:
Summary

New issue opened addressing redirect problems while documentation updates merged

Activity

  • Redirect issue opened by Zachary Vance reporting broken links from old v3.ocaml.org URLs using 301 redirects instead of 302, affecting widespread web links (#3001)
  • Documentation improvements merged including Jakub Svec's Maps tutorial update (#3009) and governance updates (#2996, #2994)
  • Content additions delivered through new blog posts, ppxlib changelog entries (#2998), Platform Newsletter Q4 2024 (#2995), and university course corrections (#2993)
  • Automated content updates maintained through regular OCaml Planet blog post integration (#3008, #3006, #3000)
entry.summary: Content improvements week with Maps tutorial enhancements and tool modernization

entry.title: Week 9, 2025: Tutorial improvements and technical refactoring with updated documentation for OCaml language concepts
entry.content:
Summary

One documentation PR opened for option.md tutorial improvements, plus ongoing work on various website infrastructure issues

Activity

  • Documentation PR opened by Jakub Svec for option.md tutorial with additional examples and improved explanations (#2986)
  • Website link issues reported including broken contribute link on businesses page by @sabine (#2989) and stale mailing list archive link by Michael Hendricks (#2988)
  • Feature request discussion continued for adding report issue links to pages with Nonye showing interest in completing the task originally proposed by Antonin Décimo (#2604)
  • Automated content updates from OCaml Planet scraping workflow adding new blog posts and videos (#2990, #2985)

entry.title: Week 8, 2025: Content improvements with new book addition, duplicate page removal, and comprehensive markdown formatting improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Documentation quality improvements and content additions with focus on consistency and user experience

Activity

  • Content additions delivered through new book integration by Imad Aldij and blog post additions to OCaml Planet (#2962, #2976)
  • Site organization improvements by Bozhidar Batsov including duplicate page removal with proper redirections (#2968) and comprehensive markdown formatting standardization (#2967)
  • Content maintenance through Fabrice Le Fessant updating OCamlPro company information (#2970) and sabine correcting blog post metadata (#2977)

entry.title: Week 7, 2025: Website improvements with UTF-8 encoding fix, tutorial enhancements, and documentation corrections
entry.content:

Documentation improvements and infrastructure fixes with community issue reporting on manual accessibility

Activity

  • Manual encoding issue resolved through middleware implementation adding UTF-8 charset to text/plain files by Cuihtlauac Alvarado (#2957)
  • Tutorial content enhancement with domain-specific language preamble explaining cloud terminology usage throughout project examples (#2954)
  • Code example corrections fixing variable reference errors in sorting cookbook and improving documentation clarity (#2960, #2958, #2951)
  • Weekly content updates including new OCaml Planet blog posts and videos integration (#2953)
entry.summary: Website improvements with UTF-8 encoding fix, tutorial enhancements, and documentation corrections

entry.title: Week 6, 2025: New Argon2 password hashing cookbook recipe, automated changelog scraping tool, and Planet blog posts added
entry.content:
Summary

Automated changelog scraping tool opened for detecting missing release changelogs across OCaml ecosystem projects

Activity

  • Changelog automation PR opened by Jules Aguillon introducing data scraper for detecting missing changelogs by monitoring GitHub release feeds across OCaml ecosystem projects (#2949)
  • Content updates through automated scraping including OCaml Weekly News for February 4th and MirageOS on OCaml 5 blog post from Tarides (ecd9974, 297c90d)
entry.summary: New Argon2 password hashing cookbook recipe, automated changelog scraping tool, and Planet blog posts added

entry.title: Week 5, 2025: Historic conference assets migrated to filesystem with new serving system and documentation improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Major infrastructure improvements for serving historic assets, plus regular content updates

Activity

  • Infrastructure modernization delivered through filesystem-based asset serving replacing external redirects, improving reliability for historic conference materials (#2756)
  • Bug fix resolved for broken meeting resource links that were causing redirect loops, with Tim McGilchrist reporting the issue (#2754)
  • Documentation consistency achieved by standardizing REPL exit command across all tutorials and examples (#2947)
  • Content updates included OCamlformat 0.27.0 changelog addition (#2946) and new OCaml Planet blog posts (#2945, #2942)
entry.summary: Historic conference assets migrated to filesystem with new serving system and documentation improvements

entry.title: Week 4, 2025: PR templates added for cookbook contributions, RSS feed bug fix, and documentation link correction
entry.content:
Summary

New issues opened for broken links and job listing validation, plus cookbook contribution guidelines enhanced

Activity

  • Link checker workflow reported as broken by sabine requiring investigation (#2935)
  • Job listing link validation proposed for GitHub Actions workflow to automatically check outdated job postings by sabine with Labdhi volunteering to implement (#2936)
  • Package version URL mangling issue identified by Matthieu Sozeau affecting redirects with reference to similar rocq-prover issue (#2931)
  • Cookbook PR template successfully completed and merged by sabine after Labdhi implementation (#2904)
  • Cmarkit documentation links remain broken on package pages with Vitor S. Almeida investigating GitHub README parsing issues that redirect incorrectly to ocaml.org instead of GitHub (#2899)
entry.summary: PR templates added for cookbook contributions, RSS feed bug fix, and documentation link correction

entry.title: Week 3, 2025: Industrial users page improvement and automatic blog content updates across multiple PRs
entry.content:
Summary

Multiple automatic content updates and one bug fix revert during week

Activity

  • Bug fix implementation for industrial users count display by multiple contributors, with initial fix (#2922), subsequent revert (#2925), and corrected implementation (#2926)
  • Automatic content updates through scrape workflow with five new OCaml Planet blog posts and videos added throughout the week (#2923, #2924, #2928, #2929)
  • Code formatting improvements with fmt tool applied to codebase (#2927)
entry.summary: Industrial users page improvement and automatic blog content updates across multiple PRs

entry.title: Week 2, 2025: OCaml 5.3.0 release content added, load testing infrastructure introduced, multiple tutorial fixes applied
entry.content:
Summary

Major OCaml 5.3.0 release content integration, tutorial improvements, and multiple bug fixes addressed

Activity

  • OCaml 5.3.0 release content fully integrated with comprehensive changelog and release page by Cuihtlauac Alvarado (#2905)
  • Tutorial improvements including removal of "tree" tool section from getting started guide (#2909) and utop exit instructions added to installation guide (#2912)
  • Reference manual downloads bug fixed for OCaml 5.3 preventing 404 errors on PDF and text format downloads (#2913)
  • Content updates with new OCaml Planet blog posts and videos automatically scraped and added (#2908, #2910, #2918)
  • Discussion improvements imported from discuss announcements for better cross-platform consistency (#2914)
entry.summary: OCaml 5.3.0 release content added, load testing infrastructure introduced, multiple tutorial fixes applied

entry.title: Week 1, 2025: Tutorial improvements and new OCaml Planet content with one new enhancement issue opened
entry.content:
Summary

One new enhancement issue opened for Windows compilation support

Activity

  • Windows compilation enhancement opened by Cuihtlauac Alvarado seeking to enable ocaml.org compilation on Windows platform with build system improvements (#2780)
  • Pull Request Template initiative launched by @sabine to create contribution guidelines for OCaml Cookbook submissions (#2904)

entry.title: Week 52, 2024: OCaml Planet content updates with new blog posts and contributor issues focused on Windows compilation and documentation links
entry.content:
Summary

Two new issues opened regarding documentation link problems and ongoing discussion about Windows compilation support

Activity

  • Documentation link issues reported by Stephen Bastians for broken extended documentation link (#2898) and Labdhi for 404 error on cmarkit doc examples link (#2899)
  • Windows compilation support discussion continued with Labdhi volunteering to work on compilation issues initiated by Cuihtlauac Alvarado (#2780)
  • Debugging documentation improvement proposed by Patrick Nicodemus with suggested PR for linking to stdlib debugging section (#2827)
entry.summary: OCaml Planet content updates with new blog posts and contributor issues focused on Windows compilation and documentation links

entry.title: Week 51, 2024: OCaml Planet filtering improvements, RSS feed fixes, tutorial enhancements, and website infrastructure updates
entry.content:
Summary

Five new issues opened including RSS feed bugs, UI feedback, package search concerns, and documentation improvements

Activity

  • Five new issues opened addressing various website concerns including RSS feed displaying outdated entries by @sabine (#2886), home page trophy design feedback (#2887), and package search returning stale OCaml 5-incompatible packages by @v-gb (#2884)
  • Content improvements with automatic scraping adding 18 new blog posts from Thomas Letan's blog (#2880) and regular Planet updates (#2888, #2876, #2873)
  • Documentation enhancements including changelog updates for Dune 3.17.1 (#2874) and OCaml 5.3.0~rc1 (#2885), plus academic papers additions (#2872)
  • Infrastructure improvements with Dockerfile cleanup (#2866) and fixes for RSS feed filtering that required multiple iterations to resolve edge cases (#2882, #2889, #2890)
entry.summary: OCaml Planet filtering improvements, RSS feed fixes, tutorial enhancements, and website infrastructure updates

entry.title: Week 50, 2024: Extensive cookbook expansion with new cookbook recipes, new success stories for Nitrokey and terrateam, and infrastructure improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Four new success stories opened this week, exercise documentation bug fix, cookbook expansion, and ongoing PR discussions about parsing examples

Activity

  • Four new success stories opened by sabine including updated Ahrefs story with full-stack OCaml web solution (#2863), Robur cooperative success story (#2862), Imandra formal verification platform story (#2868), and Parsimoni success story (#2857)
  • Exercise documentation regression identified and fixed by João Artur regarding missing examples in Exercise 3, with quick resolution and acknowledgment of the regression (#2858, #2859)
  • Success stories merged including Nitrokey's NetHSM hardware security module story (#2855) and terrateam.io infrastructure automation story (#2856)
  • Ongoing cookbook development with Richard Huxton working on command-line argument parsing recipes using Cmdliner and stdlib approaches, though needing improvements for API coverage and task consistency (#2573)
  • Infrastructure discussions by Marek Kubica about dependency constraints and build system improvements, with ongoing debate about opam repository pinning versus dependency versioning (#2760)
  • Content updates including OCaml Planet blog post scraping (#2860, #2852) and URL updates in existing success stories (#2854)
entry.summary: Extensive cookbook expansion with new cookbook recipes, new success stories for Nitrokey and terrateam, and infrastructure improvements

entry.title: Week 49, 2024: Week focused on cookbook content expansion with new recipes for HTTP authentication, hex encoding, and regex parsing
entry.content:
Summary

Week dominated by content improvements with new cookbook recipes, documentation updates, and automated blog post additions

Activity

  • Cookbook expansion with three substantial new recipes covering essential programming tasks: HTTP authentication using Bearer tokens by @ggsmith842, hex string encoding/decoding by @ggsmith842, and regex-based date parsing by Cuihtlauac Alvarado (#2534, #2445, #2404)
  • Documentation quality improvements including email validation cookbook enhancement with RFC5322-compliant patterns by Frédéric Loyer (#2591) and basic datatypes tutorial correction by @vincentsavard (#2849)
  • Release documentation with Dune 3.17.0 changelog addition by @marekkubica covering new features and improvements (#2848)
  • Automated content updates with OCaml Planet blog posts and videos added through automated scraping by Cuihtlauac Alvarado (#2850)
entry.summary: Week focused on cookbook content expansion with new recipes for HTTP authentication, hex encoding, and regex parsing

entry.title: Week 48, 2024: Major cookbook expansion with new networking and XML recipes, OCaml 5.3.0-beta2 changelog, and tutorial fixes
entry.content:
Summary

Active cookbook development and content curation with improved organization and new OCaml Planet blog posts

Activity

  • Cookbook content expansion delivered through multiple merged PRs including networking recipes (#2400), XML processing (#2401), HTTP requests (#2402), and concurrency patterns (#2377, #2584)
  • Cookbook organization improvements including alphabetical repositioning of networking section (#2834) and package ordering corrections (#2841)
  • Content quality fixes addressing TrustInSoft attribution corrections (#2838) and broken link repairs (#2836)
  • OCaml Planet updates with automated blog post and video aggregation (#2833, #2835) including new content from MirageOS and Frama-C projects
  • Tutorial documentation improvements with fixed type signatures and code examples enhancing learning resources (#2842, #2843)
entry.summary: Major cookbook expansion with new networking and XML recipes, OCaml 5.3.0-beta2 changelog, and tutorial fixes

entry.title: Week 47, 2024: OCaml 5.2.1 release documentation added and website infrastructure improvements made
entry.content:
Summary

Website maintenance activities with job listing removal and CI workflow improvements

Activity

  • OCaml Planet content updates with automated scraping of new blog posts and videos from various sources (#2828, #2824, #2821)
  • Infrastructure improvements including CI workflow enhancement with manual trigger support and OCaml version pinning (#2823)
  • Content curation activities with removal of XenServer job listing and addition of FUN OCaml YouTube channel to video sources (#2825, #2820)

entry.title: Week 46, 2024: Content updates with new textbook addition, opam 2.3.0 changelog, Dune developer tools guide, and bot blocking improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Two new issues opened addressing playground missing modules and tutorial content concerns, alongside six merged content updates

Activity

  • Two new issues opened including Haz reporting playground missing modules like Bool, Unit, Either in the OCaml playground (#2812) and Cuihtlauac Alvarado identifying tutorial content issues in the Values and Functions section (#2811)
  • CS51 textbook request fulfilled with Imad Aldij successfully proposing and having Harvard's "Programming Well: Abstraction and Design in Computation" textbook added to complement existing resources (#2808)
  • Documentation expansion through multiple merged PRs including opam 2.3.0 release documentation and Dune installation guides, enhancing the ecosystem information available to users
entry.summary: Content updates with new textbook addition, opam 2.3.0 changelog, Dune developer tools guide, and bot blocking improvements

entry.title: Week 45, 2024: Website updates with enhanced Windows support, changelog releases, and documentation improvements
entry.content:
Summary

Repository maintenance focused on documentation updates and release announcements with 10 commits

Activity

  • Windows installation documentation received a complete rewrite by contributors to modernize the installation process, replacing deprecated tools with current opam 2.2+ recommendations and adding comprehensive setup instructions for Windows users
  • Changelog infrastructure improvements with enhanced guidelines for contributors and clarification of the changelog's purpose as a user-oriented blog rather than traditional changelog
  • Release coordination activities with multiple changelog entries for OCaml 5.2.1-rc1, OCaml 5.3.0-beta1, opam 2.3.0~rc1, and Dune 3.16.1 releases
  • Content aggregation through automated OCaml Planet blog post integration bringing fresh community content to the website
entry.summary: Website updates with enhanced Windows support, changelog releases, and documentation improvements

entry.title: Week 44, 2024: None

entry.title: Week 43, 2024: Build system improvements with Dune template preprocessing and three community issues including package count discrepancies
entry.content:
Summary

Three community-reported issues addressed website functionality including package statistics accuracy and blog scraping reliability

Activity

  • Package statistics discrepancy reported by Shon Feder showing "new packages this month" displaying 42 packages when actual count should be 197+ new packages in October (#2791)
  • Planet feed scraper inquiry from Hannes Mehnert regarding missing blog post from Robur, which was subsequently resolved when scraper automatically updated content (#2784)
  • Cookbook testing automation proposal by @sabine requesting GitHub Action to regularly validate cookbook examples work with updated package versions (#2786)

entry.title: Week 42, 2024: Website content updates including opam 2.3.0-beta1 announcement and technical date format fix
entry.content:
Summary

Content publishing focused on opam beta release announcement and regular OCaml Planet blog updates

Activity

  • opam 2.3.0-beta1 announcement published with comprehensive feature overview including new compiler management, enhanced dependency handling, and improved conflict resolution (#2776)
  • OCaml Planet content regularly updated with three automated scraping sessions adding new blog posts and videos from the community (#2774, #2775, #2778)
  • Virtual event listings expanded with two upcoming Reason OCaml India meetups for October covering advanced OCaml topics (#2779)
  • Content fixes included resolving duplicate wording on the front page identified by community feedback (#2771)
